author: John Pike
title: Russia Has Become Significantly Stronger Over Past Year - Lavrov
text:
Russia Has Become Significantly Stronger Over Past Year - Lavrov
20231228
MOSCOW, December 28 (Sputnik) - Russia has become significantly stronger over the past year, with the people opposing the West in the hybrid war it has unleashed, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said in an interview with Sputnik and the Rossiya 24 broadcaster.
"As a result of this hybrid war of the entire collective West against Russia, which was unleashed by the hands, bodies and all other components of Ukrainian society against us ... Russia has become significantly stronger this year, and the unity of our people has increased significantly," Lavrov said.
The top diplomat added that the West's plan to inflict a "strategic defeat" on Russia had failed miserably.
"The West is indeed changing its tactics, probably even thinking about restructuring its strategy. Even if we claim that the 'strategic defeat of Russia' was the strategy, forgive me for repeating, then the strategy has failed miserably," Lavrov stated.
He stressed that since US has labelled Russia as its "enemy", Moscow is ready for any course of events.
Fairer Economic World Order Imminent
These days, the advance of a fairer economic order cannot be stopped, said Sergey Lavrov.
"The movement towards a fairer world order, economic world order, is, of course, unstoppable".
He recalled that developing countries and BRICS members have been demanding IMF and World Bank quotas that would reflect their real economic standing, but the West has been reluctant. Russia's top diplomat stressed that this case is yet another example of how the US violates the principles of honest free market competition.
Lavrov added that the world majority grew very tired of the US dollar as the main reserve currency, because it has turned into a tool of political pressure.
No Bright Future for European Union
Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said in an interview with Sputnik and the Rossiya 24 broadcaster that he does not see any bright future for the European Union.
"I do not see such a rosy future, or rather, I do not see a rosy future in a good sense for the European Union. In other senses, they have already defined this future for themselves," Lavrov said.
Demilitarization and Denazification of Ukraine Will Be Implemented
The top diplomat stressed that Russia plans to achieve all the goals of the special military operation in the wake of changes in Ukraine.
"We are preparing to implement all the goals that were set. Demilitarization, denazification. You can't escape it," he said.
Zelensky Has Betrayed His People
Sergey Lavrov said that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is a traitor. He recalled that recently the Ukrainian leader said that he had forgotten the Russian language and his words looked as if they were parts of a play.
The top diplomat added that years earlier Zelensky had urged to "leave Russians alone" and pretended that Russian was his language and at the same time he was a citizen of Ukraine. Russia's foreign policy chief lamented that Zelensky was unable to stick to this position.
"He betrayed his people. And not just one, he betrayed two of his nations," Lavrov concluded.

author: afp
title: Les salariés de Boeing votent la grève à une écrasante majorité - 20 minutes
text: États-UnisLes salariés de Boeing votent la grève à une écrasante majorité La grève, votée jeudi soir par les travailleurs, entraînera la fermeture de deux grandes usines d’assemblage d’avions dans l'État de Washington. Les salariés de Boeing de la région de Seattle, aux Etats-Unis, ont voté à une très large majorité en faveur d’une grève dès vendredi, rejetant la nouvelle convention proposée par l’avionneur américain en difficulté, a annoncé leur syndicat. Les travailleurs ont rejeté la convention à 94,6% et voté jeudi soir la grève à 96%, a précisé Jon Holden, président du syndicat des machinistes IAM-District 751. «Nous ferons grève à minuit», soit à 9h (heure en Suisse) vendredi, a-t-il ajouté. «Nos membres se sont exprimés haut et fort ce soir», a affirmé M. Holden, dont le syndicat qui représente environ 33'000 travailleurs dans le nord-ouest du Pacifique, avait initialement soutenu l’accord. M. Holden avait auparavant déclaré ne pas pouvoir «garantir que nous obtiendrons davantage en faisant grève». Production paralysée La grève entraînera la fermeture de deux grandes usines d’assemblage d’avions dans la région de Puget Sound, les deux tiers des votes étaient nécessaires pour lancer un arrêt de travail dès l’expiration jeudi à minuit de la convention actuelle, vieille de 16 ans. Elle va paralyser la production du 737, du 777 et du 767 cargo, dont les livraisons cumulent déjà les retards. Une situation d’autant plus problématique que l’avionneur encaisse la plus grosse partie du paiement (environ 60%) à la remise des avions. Selon les analystes de TD Cowen, une grève de 50 jours priverait Boeing de 3 à 3,5 milliards de dollars de liquidités et aurait un impact de 5,5 milliards sur le chiffre d’affaires. Le vote de jeudi marque un rejet décisif d’un accord qui, selon les travailleurs, était bien moins généreux que ne l’affirmaient les dirigeants de Boeing. Cette nouvelle convention, qui concerne les adhérents de l’IAM dans la région de Seattle (nord-ouest), prévoyait une hausse salariale de 25% sur quatre ans ainsi qu’un engagement d’investissements dans la région. Dernière grève en 2008 Boeing espérait que ces concessions suffiraient à esquiver une grève, alors que sa situation financière est précaire depuis le crash de deux 737 MAX 8 en 2018 et en 2019, ayant coûté la vie à 346 personnes, et une multitude de problèmes de qualité de la production. Une semaine après sa prise de fonction, M. Ortberg s’était engagé à «réinitialiser» la relation avec l’IAM. Mais à la lecture de l’accord, de nombreux syndiqués ont réagi négativement et plaidé pour un arrêt de travail. «On nous a bradés», a lancé jeudi Kamie Bryan, employée chez Boeing depuis 18 ans, après avoir voté contre l’accord et pour la grève. «Nous ne devrions pas prendre ces quelques sous qu’ils nous donnent et être reconnaissants», a-t-elle relevé, insistant sur l’ampleur des «revenus du patron». Les télévisions ont montré des rassemblements quotidiens d’ouvriers protestant dans les usines contre des mesures salariales qu’ils estiment inadéquates face à l’inflation. Boeing fait l’objet d’une supervision accrue depuis un incident en vol début janvier sur un 737 MAX 9 d’Alaska Airlines. Survenu après une série de problèmes de conformité et de contrôle qualité, il a ravivé les questions soulevées sur ces mêmes lacunes après les deux crashes. La dernière grève chez l’avionneur américain remonte à 2008 et avait duré 57 jours.

author: La Gaceta
title: Pichetto, a favor de la iniciativa del Gobierno de eliminar las PASO
text:
Miguel Pichetto, presidente del bloque Hacemos Coalición Federal, ha manifestado su apoyo a la propuesta del Gobierno de eliminar las Primarias Abiertas Simultáneas y Obligatorias (PASO). No obstante, enfrenta una considerable oposición dentro de su propio bloque, que incluye a ex PRO, peronistas cordobeses y socialistas, entre otros. Algunos miembros prominentes, como Emilio Monzó y Nicolás Massot, solo estarían dispuestos a discutir la obligatoriedad del voto en las primarias, mientras que otros, como Florencio Randazzo, coautor de las PASO, defienden su permanencia.
El socialismo, representado por diputados como Esteban Paulón y Mónica Fein, también se opone a la eliminación de las PASO, argumentando que estas permiten la representación de las minorías en los partidos políticos. La UCR, bajo el liderazgo de Rodrigo de Loredo, y el PRO, encabezado en la Cámara por Cristian Ritondo, muestran una clara resistencia a la propuesta. Incluso dentro de Unión por la Patria, el impulso inicial del Gobierno de Cristina Kirchner hace improbable cualquier cambio significativo sin enfrentar oposición interna.
La iniciativa gubernamental enfrenta una pausa, debido a la falta de consenso y las resistencias encontradas en diversas bancadas. Guillermo Francos, jefe de Gabinete, ha detenido temporalmente el envío de la reforma política al Congreso. En tanto, la Coalición Cívica propone eliminar la obligatoriedad de las PASO, mientras el Frente de Izquierda denuncia intenciones ocultas del Gobierno, como la eliminación del financiamiento público a las campañas y la reducción de espacios gratuitos en medios de comunicación.
En resumen, la propuesta del Gobierno de eliminar las PASO ha generado un debate intenso y divisiones tanto dentro de Hacemos Coalición Federal como en otros bloques políticos. La falta de consenso y las variadas opiniones reflejan la complejidad de implementar una reforma electoral significativa en el actual panorama político argentino.

author: #4722 wb
title: 日本岩手县山火持续燃烧 民众不安情绪加剧_新闻频道_中华网
text:
日本岩手县大船渡市2月26日下午发生多起山林火灾，至今已持续超过一周。3月5日，大船渡市出现降雨天气，但降雨对于火情的影响目前仍不明确，进山道路仍处于全面封闭状态。
山火遇降雨天气空中灭火暂停
岩手县警察：从这里往前山区的道路禁止进入，消防车辆或其他紧急情况下需要进入的情况，可能会被特别允许，但基本上所有人都禁止进入。
截至5日，大船渡市已经有累计超过1800户家庭的4500余人进行了转移。5日，当地出现降雨，但降雨对于火情的影响目前仍不明确。
岩手县大船渡地区消防本部消防司令小野田利文：目前看起来火势并未扩大。但未来仍不能排除因天气变化而导致火势蔓延的可能性。5日由于天气状况不佳，无法进行空中灭火作业，但从6日起，将视天气情况恢复空中灭火行动。
总台记者何欣蕾：岩手县大船渡市的山林火灾从2月26日开始算起，到目前为止已经持续超过一周的时间。根据当地政府的最新统计，目前这一场火灾的过火面积已经达到了大约2900公顷，造成一人死亡，78处房屋受损。目前关于火灾发生的原因还没有明确的调查结果。

author: @hab.mk
title: В Хабаровском крае все подтопленные дороги освободились от воды | Society | Seldon News
text: В Хабаровском крае на утро 11 июля все подтопленные участки освободились от воды. По данным регионального МЧС, сейчас дорожники занимаются ремонтно-восстановительными работами для обеспечения проезда. В крае подтопленных территорий не осталось. Гидрологическая обстановка на реках под наблюдением спасателей. За последние сутки подъем уровней на 20-66 см наблюдали на реках Кур, Амгунь, Нимелен, Уда. Угрозы хозяйственным объектам нет. До 1,4 метров на некоторых участках наблюдаются подтопления пойм Буреи, Маномы, Сукпая, Амгуни, Гура и Кура. Уровень Амура составил на утро 164 см, существенных... author: AB Newswire
title: The Internet of Things (IoT): An Indispensable Element in the Current Digital Epoch | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
In the prevailing digital epoch, the Internet of Things (IoT) has surfaced as an indispensable element. The IoT is an intricate matrix of physical entities, or ‘things’, that possess the ability to connect to the internet. These IoT devices can span from ordinary household commodities to intricate industrial apparatus.
The IoT has transformed the manner in which individuals exist and operate, rendering everyday chores more efficient and expedient. It has also paved the way for new prospects for businesses, empowering them to streamline procedures, enhance customer service, and devise new business models.
The Necessity of Overseeing IoT Devices
Monitor status of IoT devices is a crucial facet of administering an IoT network. This involves amassing, scrutinizing, and managing data from these devices. The data amassed from IoT devices can offer valuable insights into their performance and functionality, aiding in identifying potential issues and implementing necessary measures to prevent or rectify problems.
RemoteIoT: A Premier Instrument for IoT Supervision
RemoteIoT is a premier instrument for IoT supervision. It offers a platform for users to supervise the status of their IoT devices, exhibit device data, and trigger alerts and notifications in real time. This instrument is particularly beneficial for businesses that heavily rely on IoT devices for their operations.
Supervising Specific IoT Devices: A Deep Dive into Raspberry Pi
In the expansive and ever-evolving landscape of the Internet of Things (IoT), certain devices have carved a niche for themselves. They possess a unique blend of features and capabilities that set them apart from the crowd. One such device that has captured the imagination of many is the Raspberry Pi.
The Raspberry Pi, despite its diminutive size, is a powerful computer that can comfortably nestle in the palm of people’s hand. It’s a marvel of modern technology, packing enough power to handle a diverse range of IoT tasks. From controlling smart home devices to serving as a server, the Raspberry Pi can do it all.
This tiny powerhouse has won the hearts of everyone, from weekend hobbyists experimenting in their garages to seasoned professionals developing complex systems. Its flexibility and affordability are its major selling points, making it an accessible and versatile tool in the realm of IoT.
However, the task of monitoring the status of a Raspberry Pi is not as straightforward as one might think. It requires a specialized set of tools and a particular skill set, each tailored to the device and its specific functions. These tools provide real-time insights into the device’s performance, allowing users to keep a close eye on its operation.
Monitor status of a Raspberry Pi , or any IoT device for that matter, is a mission-critical task. The primary objective is to ensure the device is running smoothly, performing its tasks efficiently, and maintaining its health. Early detection of potential issues is key to this process. Spotting a problem before it escalates can save time, effort, and resources.
Enhanced Efficiency and Cost Savings
Monitor status of IoT devices ensures they are operating at their peak performance. This optimal functioning can significantly enhance efficiency. For instance, in an industrial setting, well-monitored IoT devices can streamline operations, reduce downtime, and increase productivity. Moreover, efficient devices consume less energy, leading to substantial cost savings in the long run.
Proactive Maintenance and Extended Device Longevity
IoT device supervision allows for the early detection of potential issues. This early detection facilitates proactive maintenance and repairs. For example, a temperature sensor in an IoT-enabled HVAC system might be showing readings that are consistently off by a few degrees. By catching this early, users can recalibrate or replace the sensor before it results in significant energy waste or damage to other components. Such a proactive approach not only enhances the device’s performance but also extends its lifespan, leading to further cost savings.
Informed Decision-Making and Strategy Development
Supervising IoT devices also provides valuable insights into device usage patterns. These insights can be instrumental for businesses in understanding how their devices are being utilized. For instance, usage patterns can reveal peak usage times, user preferences, and even potential misuse of the devices. This data can guide decision-making processes, aid in the development of effective strategies, and inform future IoT deployments. It can also help businesses to tailor their services more closely to their customers’ needs, improving customer satisfaction and potentially opening up new revenue streams.
Security and Compliance
Another critical aspect of IoT device supervision is security. With the increasing prevalence of IoT devices, they have become attractive targets for cybercriminals. Effective supervision includes monitoring for any signs of security breaches, such as unusual data patterns or unauthorized access attempts, and taking swift action to address them. Additionally, in regulated industries, IoT device supervision can help ensure compliance with standards and regulations, such as data protection and privacy laws.
Conclusion
In conclusion, as the world becomes increasingly interconnected, the importance of IoT supervision continues to grow. Tools like RemoteIoT and techniques for supervising specific devices like the Raspberry Pi are simplifying the process of tracking devices and ensuring their optimal functionality. As we continue to navigate the digital age, the role of IoT supervision will only become more critical. It is indeed an exhilarating time to be part of this technological revolution.

author: AFP
title: Sweden finally joins NATO, ending non-alignment, in Ukraine war shadow | Jordan Times
text: You are here Sweden finally joins NATO, ending non-alignment, in Ukraine war shadow By AFP - Mar 08,2024 - Last updated at Mar 08,2024 AFP photo US Secretary of State Antony Blinken receives the NATO ratification documents from Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson during a ceremony at the US State Department, as Sweden formally joins the North Atlantic alliance, in Washington, DC, on Thursday WASHINGTON — Sweden on Thursday became the 32nd member of NATO in the shadow of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, turning the page on two centuries of non-alignment and capping two years of torturous diplomacy. Days after Hungary followed key holdout Turkey and became the last NATO member to sign off, Sweden ceremonially handed over accession documents to the United States, the leading force of the transatlantic alliance that provides joint security for all. "It is a major step but, at the same time, a very natural step," Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson said at the State Department. The accession "is a victory for freedom today. Sweden has made a free, democratic, sovereign and united choice to join NATO", he said. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that few would have expected Sweden as well as Finland to join NATO before Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. There is "no clearer example than today of the strategic debacle that Putin's invasion of Ukraine has become for Russia", Blinken said. Sweden has not been involved in a war, including World War II, since the Napoleonic conflicts of the early 19th century. Sweden and Finland, while militarily intertwined with the United States and both members of the European Union, had historically steered clear of officially joining NATO, formed in the Cold War to unite against the Soviet Union. Finland and Sweden launched a joint bid shortly after the invasion of Ukraine, which itself had unsuccessfully sought to join NATO — an alliance that under Article 5, considers an attack on one member an attack on all. Finland successfully joined in April 2023, but Sweden’s membership was stalled by Turkey. “Good things come to those who wait,” Blinken said as he received the documents from Sweden. “Some doubted we’d get here; we never did.” ‘Historic day’ The Swedish prime minister is set later Thursday to attend the annual State of the Union address by President Joe Biden, who has been struggling to persuade the rival Republican Party to approve new aid to Ukraine. Russia has vowed “countermeasures” over Sweden’s entry into NATO, especially if the alliance’s troops and assets deploy in the country. Sweden’s blue and golden-yellow flag is expected to be hoisted on Monday at the Brussels headquarters of the North Atlantic Treaty Alliance. “This is a historic day. Sweden will now take its rightful place at NATO’s table, with an equal say in shaping NATO policies and decisions,” NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said in a statement. “After over 200 years of non-alignment Sweden now enjoys the protection granted under Article 5, the ultimate guarantee of allies’ freedom and security,” he said. Before agreeing to ratify membership, Turkey used its leverage to press Sweden, known for its liberal asylum policies, to crack down on Kurdish militants who have campaigned against Ankara. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan later demanded action after protesters, enjoying Swedish laws on free speech, desecrated Islam’s holy book the Koran. In a clear if unstated sweetener, the United States dangled the prospect of F-16 warplanes to Turkey, which has faced the wrath of US sanctions over a major military purchase from Russia. The Biden administration in January approved $23 billion in F-16 warplanes to Turkey swiftly after it ratified Sweden’s membership. The United States simultaneously pushed ahead with $8.6 billion in more advanced F-35 jets for Greece, a fellow NATO member that has a historic rivalry and frequent tensions with Turkey. Even with Turkey’s blessing, Sweden faced another obstacle as it needed approval of a last country — Hungary, whose nationalist prime minister, Viktor Orban, has often thumbed his nose at Western allies. The Hungarian parliament ratified Sweden’s membership on February 26. But in one last hiccup, Hungary could not formally sign the accession document due to a brief absence in the mostly ceremonial post of president, after an Orban ally resigned in a scandal over pardoning a convicted child abuser’s accomplice. [up](/news/world/sweden-finally-joins-nato-ending-non-alignment-ukraine-war-shadow?rate=0TBNa4gUjwsjHqjbiTWgyWzmnSX_mPlobRIgOVgNnck) Related Articles BRUSSELS — NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said Thursday that Turkey had assured allies it remains committed to a deal to ratify Sweden’s member ANKARA — Turkey's parliament on Tuesday ratified Sweden's NATO membership after more than a year of delays that upset Western efforts to sho ISTANBUL — President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey officially submitted Sweden’s NATO membership application to parliament on Monday, his o Opinion Mar 08, 2024 Mar 07, 2024 - Popular - Rated - Commented Mar 07, 2024 Mar 06, 2024 Newsletter Get top stories and blog posts emailed to you each day.
